com.magnet.security.api.oauth

Class OAuthLoginException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • java.lang.SecurityException
            • com.magnet.security.api.oauth.OAuthLoginException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class OAuthLoginException
extends SecurityException
    The OAuthLoginException represents the need to authenticate to an OAuthProvider when the platform can not find the access token for a given oauthprovider. Typically the exception wraps enough information to produce valid OAuth 302 redirect with the client id, [optionally, client secret], redirect_uri and state. The exception may be serialized and propagated over rest to the mobile client. The mobile client will handle the exception and issue a http request to match the 302.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
